properties.title: Eighth National Press Week
properties.description: Visiting fashion editors from leading newspapers of the United States and Canada will be in N. Y. during the week of January 6, for the Eighth National Press Week. They will see couture collections from New York Dress Institute designers, to be shown daily from 9:30 A.M. to 4:30 P.M. with two evening showings during the week. By invitation only. Publicity: Eleanor Lambert, PL. 5-8580.

properties.title: Preview of Teen Fashions
properties.description: A preview of all the merchandise that will be featured editorially and advertised in the February, March, April and May issues of Calling All Girls Magazine. Teen fashions from more than 50 leading resources, with merchandise assembled for quick "birds eye" viewing and complete listings distributed for buyers’ convenience. Contacts Nancy Pepper, MU. 54400.

properties.title: Luncheon for Out-of-Town Editors
properties.description: Luncheon for visiting editors to mark official opening of Press Week. Press strictly by invitation. Publicity: Eleanor Lambert, PL. 5-8580.

properties.title: THE PRESS SHOWING OF THE LINDELLE SPRING BAG COLLECTION,
properties.description: THE PRESS SHOWING OF THE LINDELLE SPRING BAG COLLECTION, ORIGINALLY SCHEDULED FOR MONDAY, JANUARY 6, AT 4:30 P.M., HAS BEEN CANCELLED.

properties.title: Showing of New Lingerie Fashion
properties.description:
"Spring Chromance" -- presentation of Odette Barsa's new dramatic lingerie creations -- a new mood in at-home fashions. Showing at 5:30 P.M. For local and out-of-town press by invitation only. Publicity: Ann R. Silver
Associates, MU. 22-8633.

properties.title: Cocktail Party for Visiting Editors
properties.description: Primrose House will have a cocktail party to welcome the out-of-town editors. By invitation only. Publicity: Mary Brown, CI. 5-7434.

properties.title: “NAME -YOUR-TOWN" TALKS FOR VISITING PRESS
properties.description: “You name your town," and fur remodeling specialist Harry Jay Treu will show how he has handled the remodeling of furs from women who live in that town. Contact: LA. 4-6788,

properties.title: Spring Collection of Half-Size Dresses
properties.description: Introducing a new collection of women's half-size street dresses, fashioned for the shorter woman. Contact: Walter Ginsburg, LO. 5-0358.

properties.title: Shoe Guild Warm Weather Openings
properties.host_text: The Guild of Better Shoe Manufacturers
properties.description:
Shoes for summertime wear, featuring styles influenced by the latest trends in apparel. Delivery will be for March, April and May. In addition to the showing and sale of footwear, this opening will mark the
planning of distribution policies between manufacturers and retailers. Member firms of the Guild of Better Shoe Manufacturers are: Cangemi, Ince; Thomas Cort Ltd; Delman, Inc; Fox Shoe Mfg. Corp; Jerro Bros; Mackey-Starr, Inc; Marino; I. Miller and Sons, Inc; Newton Elkin Shoe Co. (Pandora); Palter Deliso, Inc.; Schwartz and Benjamin, Inc. (Customcraft); Setroy, Inc. (Seymour Troy Originals); Van Arden, Inc., M. Wolf Sons, Inc. (Lupine); Morris Wolock Co.; Zuckerman and Fox, Inc Contact: Kate
Goldstein Kamen, Exec Secy, 875 Fifth Avenue, RE. 4—4888.

properties.title: Fashion Show for Visiting Editors
properties.description: Mildred O'Quinn will present her Spring and Summer collection to the out-of-town editors. Showing will begin promptly at 9:00 A.M. Attendance strictly by invitation. Publicity: Nona James, VO. 5-3440.

properties.title: SHOE-VUES OF 1947"
properties.host_text: The Guild of Better Shoe Manufacturers
properties.description:
World Premiere Performance and dramatization of the future of better shoes, a vital and realistic approach to the shoe business of tomorrow. “Guild
Shoe-Vues of 1947", featuring stars of stage, screen and radio, prepared
by the top writing talent of America. By invitation only. Public relations handled by Kate Goldstein Kamen, 875 Fifth Avenue, RE. 4-48886.

properties.title: "The American Idea In Fashion"
properties.description: Presentation at 10:00 A.M. and 2:30 P.M. daily, with a press showing on Thurs., Jan 9, at 2:30 PM. By reservation. Contact: Ruth Schwartz, WI-77200.

properties.title: SEVENTH BIRTHDAY PARTY: DUBARRY SUCCESS COURSE
properties.description: Ann Delafield, director of the DuBarry Success Course, will invite local and out-of-town press to the Success Course's 7th Anniversary Birthday Luncheon. By invitation only. Publicity: Dora Miller, LO. 3-4285.

properties.title: Presentation of Awards by Mayor O'Dwyer
properties.description: Awards will be presented to the twenty-five statesmen of industry by Mayor William O'Dwyer at a special ceremony at City Hall. Press invited. Contacts Shirley D. Spaulding, Fashion Director, EL. 5-7430.

properties.title: THE LUCIENNE HARANG PRESS SHOWING OF NEW GLOVES AND BLOUSES FOR SPRING,
properties.description: THE LUCIENNE HARANG PRESS SHOWING OF NEW GLOVES AND BLOUSES FOR SPRING, ORIGINALLY SCHEDULED FOR TUESDAY, JAN. 7, AT 3:30 P.M., HAS BEEN POST+ PONED. (NEW DATE WILL BE ANNOUNCED LATER.)

properties.title: Showing of Spring and Summer Collection
properties.description: Laddie Northridge's forecast of '47 Spring and Summer hats at a showing for the N.Y. fashion press. By invitation only. Publicity: Elizabeth Maher Associates, El. 5-4248.

properties.title: Press Preview: Spring Millinery
properties.description: Presentation of Lilly Dache's new millinery collection to the press. Strictly by invitation. Publicity: Eleanor Lambert, PL. 5-8580.

properties.title: Showing of New Lingerie Fashions
properties.description: Showing at 4:30 P.M. for buyers, merchandise managers, and fashion coordinators of “Spring Chromance" -- Odette Barsa’s new dramatic lingerie creations -- a new mood in at-home fashions. By invitation only. Publicity: Ann R. Silver Associates, MU. 2-8633.

properties.title: Presentation of "Fashions For Selling"
properties.description: Cocktail party and showing of small, high-fashioned group of daytime frocks featured under the Mayflower and Amerisport labels for misses; and Nan Scott for Juniors. For press, merchandise executives and buyers, by invitation only. Publicity: Bea Baris, LO. 3-6759.

properties.title: Junior Fashion Show for Visiting Editors
properties.description: Showing of "Junior Mix and Match" fashions by Tilly Schanzer to be presented to out-of-town editors during cocktails. Attendance by invitation only. Publicity: Dora Miller, LO. 3-4285.

properties.title: Party to Celebrate Seventieth Anniversary
properties.description: Lambert Brothers’ Jewelry will celebrate their 70th anniversary with a special showing of diamonds and other fine jewelry. Attendance by invitation only. Publicity: Rosemary Sheehan, CI. 7-8060.

properties.title: Semi-Annual Press Breakfast
properties.description:
Latest millinery creations will be presented to the out-of-town fashion editors. Hats by 17 uptown designers: ANITA ANDRA, BRAAGAARD, HATTIE
CARNEGIE, LILLY DACHE, EMME, PEG FISCHER, WALTER FLORELL, MARY GOODFELLOW, MAGO HAYES, JOHN-FREDERICS, LENESTA, LADDIE NORTHRIDGE, MME. PAULINE, FLORENCE REICHMAN, MME. REINE, SUZANNE-REMY, SALLY VICTOR.
Millinery Creators Guild: BERNICE CHARLES, GERMAINE MONTABERT, HARRYSON HATS, G. HOWARD HODGE, JEANNE TETE, EDGAR J. LORIE, MILGRIM HATS. (Jewelry by Castlecliff., Publicity: Dorothy Lansing, PL. 8-3145). Attendance strictly by invitation. Publicity Mary Kelley, MU. 2-2603.

properties.title: Press Preview Spring and Summer Millinery
properties.description: Sally Victor will present a showing of her new millinery for Spring and Summer to the N. Y. fashion press. (Showing for out-of-town press on Saturday, Jan. 11). Attendance by invitation only. Contact: Mildred Josephs, Pl 3-7450.

properties.title: Showing Spring Line to Visiting Press
properties.description: Luncheon showing of Spring line of Varden Petites and Varden Casuals to be presented to the out-of-town fashion press. Attendance by invitation only Publicity: Gladys Steiner, Lester Harrison, Inc. MU. 3-1267.

properties.title: Luncheon Meeting: "Report on Germany"
properties.description:
Members' monthly luncheon meeting with a "Report on Germany” by Kathleen
MoLaughlin, member of the Berlin Bureau of "The New York Times" and just
returned from Germany. She will be introduced by Mrs. Franklin Delano
Roosevelt. Eleanor Pollock, Chairman, Program Committee. Price, including
tax and tip: $3.10 for members; $3.50 for guests. Contacts: The Fashion
Group, Inc., CI. 7-3940.

properties.title: Press Preview Spring and Summer Millinery
properties.description:
"Tomorrow, for an Indefinite Stay" -- a collection of Mme. Pauline's new
Spring and Summer millinery. Showing promptly at 4:00 P.M. Attendance
by invitation only. Publicity: Mary Alice Rice, CI. 6-1790.

properties.title: "Gems of Fashion" or "Raffles' Return"
properties.description: Kramer Jewelry Co. presents a unique fashion showing of rhinestone jewelry. Attendance by invitation only. Publicity: Billie Gould, Inc., LA 4-8773. "Crime Does Not Pay"

properties.title: Announce Winners of Teen ContestDesign
properties.description:
Miss America Magazine and Soap 'n' Water Fabrics will announce the winners
of their teen fashion design contest. For buyers and press, strictly by invitation. Contacts Aileen Fogarty, BR 9-5890.

properties.title: Millinery Showing for Visiting Editors
properties.description: Laddie Northridge's forecast of 1947 Spring and Summer hats at a showing for the out-of-town press. By invitation only. Publicity: Elizabeth Maher Associates, EL. 5-4248.

properties.title: Cocktail Party for Visiting Editors
properties.description: The out-of-town and local press will be invited to a cocktail party at Prince Matchabelli's new Crown Room. Attendance by invitation only. Publicity: Leonore Buehler, PL. 3-7010.

properties.title: Millinery Showing for Visiting Editors
properties.description: The out-of-town editors have been invited to a millinery presentation by Lilly Dache. Attendance strictly by invitation. Publicity: Eleanor Lambert, PL 5-8580.

properties.title: Thirteenth Annual Fashion Presentation
properties.host_text: National Association of House Dress Manufacturers
properties.description:
Annual fashion show marking the first efforts in the postwar period by the National Association of House Dress Manufacturers, emphasizing "Famous Labels in Daytime Fashions.” Designed by A. A. Ostrander. Directed and written by Grace Houston. By invitation only. Contact: Rudi Lazarus,
LA 4-5550.

properties.title: Breakfast Showing for Visiting Editors
properties.description: Semi-annual presentation of accessories -- Aris Gloves, Coro Jewelry, Criterion Belts, Glentex Scarfs, Glenwear Blouses, and Bienen-Davis Bags. Showing promptly at 9:00 A.M. For local and out-of-town fashion press, strictly by invitation. Publicity: Ann R. Silver Associates, MU. 2-8633.

properties.title: ‘DIAMOND DAY"
properties.description:
In response to many requests to see the process of diamond cutting, an all-day demonstration has been arranged in the Ayer offices with the cooperation of Lazare Kaplan, cutter of the Jonker diamond. Special features at 9:30 A.M., 12:00 Noon, and 5;00 P.M. Big exhibit of rough
diamonds, colored diamonds, fancy cuts. Also newest diamond jewelry by
Frank S. Hartley. Invitations have been issued.

properties.title: Press Showing of Spring Millinery
properties.description:
Presentation of Walter Florell's new Spring and Summer millinery at a showing for the press. (Buffet luncheon will be served.) Attendance by
invitation only. Contact: Burton M. Pell, PL. 50895.

properties.title: Glove Variety Show for Press
properties.description: Press preview of new colors, fabrics, and novelties in gloves by Marcel Wagner, from the most exotic long styles to the shortie for sportswear. Showing promptly at 4300 P.M. Attendance by invitation only. Publicity: Rosemary Sheehan, Cl. 7-8060.

properties.title: "Fantasy in Fashion" Movie Preview
properties.description:
Preview of Sam Friedlander's unusual motion picture, featuring 24 Moyen originals, which will be shown exclusively in 150 cities from coast to coast beginning with the first week in February. Showing at Chanin Auditorium (50th Floor) at 5:00 P.M. sharp. For movie and radio critics,
and store merchandisers. Attendance strictly by invitation. Contacts
Harriet Rhoday, PE. 6-2663.

properties.title: Press Preview: New Lingerie for 1947
properties.description: Thea Tewi will invite the local and out-of-town fashion press and buyers to a showing of her "First Collection for 1947"--new designs in intimate fashions. By invitation only. Contact: Alice 0. Steindler, PL. 3-0831.

properties.title: Millinery Showing for Visiting Editors
properties.description: Walter Florell will have a cocktail party for out-of-town fashion editors to present his new millinery collection. Attendance by invitation only. Contact: Burton iM. Pell, PL. 50895.

properties.title: New Accessories at Press Breakfast
properties.description: New accessories for Spring and Summer will be shown to the out-of-town fashion press during breakfast. Commentators Mary Margaret McBride. Attendance by invitation only. Publicity: Dora Miller, LO. 34285.

properties.title: Cocktail Buffet for Visiting Press
properties.description:
Dan River will invite the out-of-town and local press to a cocktail buffet in the North Lounge  atop the RCA Building at 30 Rockefeller Plaza.
Attendance by invitation only. Publicity: Christine Ecker, John A. Cairns
& Co., OR. 4-5600,.

properties.title: Millinery Showing for Visiting Editors
properties.description:
Sally Victor will have her semi-annual millinery fashion show and breakfast for the out-of-town press. Attendance strictly by invitation.
Contact: Mildred Josephs, PL. 3-7450.

properties.title: Picnic Supper for Visiting Editors
properties.description:
Dana Perfumes will invite the out-of-town editors to a picnic supper.
Attendance strictly by invitation. Publicity: Ruth Bolway, HA. 6-6688.

properties.title: Thirty-Sixth Annual Convention
host_controlled: National Retail Dry Goods Association (U.S.). Convention
properties.description: Theme, “Dynamic Distribution in a Free Economy". Contacts Charles E. Harnery CH. 4-8780.
associated_names: National Retail Dry Goods Association (U.S.). Convention,National Retail Dry Goods Association (U.S.)

properties.title: THE EMME MILLINERY FASHION SHOW,
properties.description: THE EMME MILLINERY FASHION SHOW, ORIGINALLY SCHEDULED FOR MONDAY,JAN. 13, HAS BEEN POSTPONED TO THURSDAY, JAN. 16, AT 4:00 P.M.

properties.title: Spring Millinery Breakfast Clinic
properties.description:
Annual Spring clinic of the Millinery Merchandising Executives’ Association, with experts in the fashion, merchandising and business worlds discussing trends, problems and developments. Virginia Pope, fashion editor, N. Y. Times, will act as director of the Clinic. Attendance by
invitation only. Publicity: Ruth Weintraub, PL. 3-2116.

properties.title: Spring Millinery Showing for Press
properties.description:
Mary Goodfellow will present her new Spring and early Summer millinery to
the press at a cocktail party. Attendance by invitation only. Publicity: Mildred Kaldor, BR. 9-9399.

properties.title: Glass Pants Party: "Fantasies of Pantasies"
properties.description: On the occasion of the opening of their new glass showrooms, Julius Kayser & Co. will present an “out of this world" entertainment and cocktail party for the press, Attendance strictly by invitation. Publicity: Ruth LeBron, WI. 2-8200.

properties.title: Exhibition of Spring Styles for Men
properties.host_text: Men's Fashion Guild of New York
properties.description:
Press showing on Tuesday, Jan. 14, from 10:00 A.M. to 12:30 P.M. Continuous showing from 1:00 P.M. to 9:00 P.M. on Tuesday and Wednesday.
Trade and press are cordially invited. Publicity: Lee Babin, The Zlowe
Co. VA. 6-4885,.

properties.title: Spring Hat Fashion Show and Dinner
properties.host_text: Millinery Stability Committee; Millinery Fashion Bureau
properties.description:
Semi-annual Spring millinery fashion show and dinner. The following milliners will present new trends in hats: UPTOWN MILLINERS: 
Anite Andra; Braagaard; Hattie Carnegie; Bernice Charles; Lilly Dache
delle Donne; Emme; Peg Fischer; Walter Florell; Germaine Montabert; Gladys & Belle; Mary Goodfellow; Harryson Hats; Mago Hayes; G. Howard Hodge; Jeanne Tete; John-Frederics; Lenesta ;Miriam Lewis; Edgar J. Lorie; Lydia; Milgrim Hats;
Laddie Northridge; Mme. Pauline; 
Florence Reichman; Mme. Reine; Sally Victor; Vogue Hats; POPULAR PRICED
Alba Hat Co.; Alfreda; Amrose Hat, Inc.; Berkley Hats; Brandt Millinery Co.; Joe Cohn Hats; Croyden Hats; Abe Del Monte Co.; Elizabeth Hat Co.; Flanzig Bros.; Oscar Friedman; Harry Furst; B. J. Goldenberg; Goldstone-Weber; Greenstein & Flaum; Harry Hikand; Lesser-Lasoff, Inc.; Luxor Hat Co.; Walter K. Marks; Millinery Fashion
Creators; Frances & Walter Nelkin; Parfait Hats; David Rothman; Morris Schachter & Co.; Schoen Hats; Schwartz & Rosenfeld; William Silverman; Woodmere Hat Co.; JUNIOR MAKERS
Bertlyn; Betmar's; John-Frederics Jr.; Greenberg-Fisch; Ann Koppelman; Madcaps; Park Avenue Jrs.; Playtoppers; Radcliffe Fashions; Vic-Debs.
Commentators Mrs. Maude G. Moody, millinery fashion editor, Women's Wear Daily. Tickets: $16.50 (including dinner); show only, $8.50 (mezzanine).
For tickets, contact Millinery Stabilization Commission, 1450 Broadway,
CH. 4-6547. Press by invitation.  Publicity Mary Kelley, MU. 2-2603.

properties.title: "Young Things" Showings of New Cottons
properties.description:
Ellen Hewitt of Delphi will present her "Young Things" line of new teenage cottons to the press and trade during breakfast. Attendance by
invitation only. Hotel Pierre Publicity Florence Lanthier, EL. 5-3644.
Ellen Hewitt Publicity: Mildred Kaldor, BR. 9-9399.

properties.title: Showing of Original Gown By Edith Head
properties.description:
Preview of fashions worn by Loretta Young and Virginia Field in the forthcoming Paramount picture, The Perfect Marriage, produced by Hal Wallis,
and featuring ten glamorous nightgowns in addition to other exciting creations designed by Edith Head. Also, "The Business Girl Silhouette",
with clothes worn by Joan Caulfield in Welcome Stranger and Dear Ruth;
and by Lizabeth Scott in Desert Fury; the "Latin American Silhouette" in
fashions created for Dorothy Lamour in My Favorite Brunette; "The Peg Top
Peplum, 1915" as illustrated by Betty Hutton in Perils of Pauline; "The Hour Glass, 1900" by Joan Fontaine in Emperor Waltz. Hats by Lilly Dache. Commentators Edith Head. Public by reservation. Press by
invitation. For reservations, contact: "Frank", headwaiter, EL. 5-3000.
Paramount Publicity: Aileen St. John Brenon, BR. 9=8700. Waldorf 1a
Publicity Office: Annette Goodrich, EL. 5-3000.

properties.title: Open House to Introduce New Package
properties.description: Cocktail party at Aberle's redecorated offices with introduction of new hosiery package. Attendance by invitation only. Publicity: Mello M. Meldram, AS. 4-0377.

properties.title: New Sophie Ready-to-Wear Millinery
properties.description: Press preview and cocktail party at the new Saks 5th Avenue ready-to-wear millinery ‘studio at 27 West 56th St., to introduce their new collection of exclusive Sophie millinery. Attendance by invitation only. Publicity Helen Kauper, Pl 3-4000.

properties.title: Press Preview of Spring Millinery
properties.description: Showing of Emme's new. Spring millinery to the press during cocktails. Attendance by invitation only Publicity: Mildred Kaldor, BR. 9-9399

properties.title: New Classics and Maternity Fashions
properties.description: Showing of pure dye and pure silk dresses by McKettrick-Williams. Also a 10 minute movie. Attendance by invitation only. Contact: Sheila Hawkins, McKettrick-Williams, WI. .7-4438. Publicity: Rosemary Sheehan, CI. 7-8060

properties.title: Press Preview of "Gallery of Ties"
properties.description: Necktie showing by Arthur Siegman. of "Signets’ Gallery of Ties." By invitation only. Publicity: Elizabeth Maher Associates EL-5-4248.

properties.title: Male Tested Fashion Presentation
properties.description: Preview of rainwear to be shown to a select male celebrity jury under the direction of Hinda Gould, Fashion Editor. By invitation only. Contacts Louise Whitney Merchandise Editor, CO 5-7300.

properties.title: Ninth Annual Bridal Business Clinic
properties.description:
The Bride's Magazine will present its Ninth Annual Bridal Business Clinic at the Waldorf-Astoria for the entire day,  beginning at 9:00 A.M. with Continental Breakfast, and ending with a gala Champagne Party on the Starlight Roof, Bridal Secretaries and Retailers from coast to coast will be on hand for a day of informative glamour. Produced by the Department of Merchandising Service, Alice Rydell, Directors Virginia Andrews,
reservations MU. 2-1490.

properties.title: "March of Dimes" Fashion Show
properties.description: Spring and Summer fashions by top New York designers will be presented at the third annual "March of Dimes" Fashion Show in New York for the benefit of the National Foundation for Infantile Paralysis. Tickets: $12.00 and $20.00. For tickets, contact: Recia Sobelson, Cl. 6-4571, Ext. 29. Press by invitation only. Director of fashion show: Lester Gaba. Publicity: Eleanor Lambert, PL. 5-8580.

properties.title: Luncheon Fashion Presentation
properties.description: Fashion show to be presented by Russeks during luncheon. Public by reservation. Press by invitation. For reservations, contact "Frank",EL. 5-3000, Russeks Publicity: Helen Moran, WI. 7-1900. Waldorf Publicity Office: Annette Goodrich, EL. 5-3000.

properties.title: Press Preview: New Millinery Collection
properties.description:
Exclusive millinery for Spring and early Summer by Germaine Vittu.
Presentation by Mme. Paule Madoc. Press strictly by invitation.
Publicitys Anna T. Moore, ST. 9-6000.

properties.title: Press Luncheon and Theatre Party
properties.description: Lane Bryant will give a preview of its new Fifth Avenue building to the press at a Luncheon-Theatre party to celebrate the opening of their new store. An original musical comedy story of Lane Bryant's history, featuring well-known personalities, will be given at 2:00 P.M., followed by a guided tour of the store. Attendance by invitation only. Publicity: Jerome Klein or Roslyn Kaye, LE. 2-0200, Ext. 9 or 10.

properties.title: Luncheon Fashion Presentation
properties.description: New fashions by Arnold Constable will be presented during luncheon.Public by reservations. Press by invitation. For reservations, contact: "Frank", EL. 5-3000. Arnold Constable Publicity: Anne Albee, CA. 5-2300, Ext. 202. Waldorf Publicity Offices Annette Goodrich, EL. 5-3000.

properties.title: Southern Hospitality Cocktail Party
properties.description: Party for press and toiletries buyers to celebrate the opening and to dedicate the new Williamsburg Room for Old South Perfumers at their N. Y. showroom. By invitation only. Contact: Muriel Johnstone, 9 Rockefeller Plaza, CI. 5-7880.

properties.title: FOGA to Show Summer Lines
properties.description: February collections will be the only lines for the season, comprising, with the Spring and Fall, a permanent program for three seasons a year Guild houses presenting Summer lines include: HANSEN BANG, INC.; FRED GREENBERG DRESS CO.; MORRIS & MARCUS; BEN BARRACK, INC.; JOSEPH HALPERT, INC.; PARNIS-LIVINGSTON; WILLIAM BASS DRESS; HORWITZ & DUBERMAN; BEN REIG, INC; CAPRI FROCKS; INTERNATIONAL DRESS CO.; GC, H. D. ROBBINS CO, ; CARLYE DRESS CORP.; JUNIOR LEAGUE FROCKS; PAUL SACHS ORIGINALS; DEITSCH, WERSBA & COPPOLA; KAPLAN & GRABOIS; MARTIN SIMON, INC, ; SAMUEL KASS GOWNS, INC.; HERBERT SONDHEIM; FOX-BROWNIE, INC.; LA RUE DRESSES, INC.; FRANK STARR, INC,; ED GERRICK, INC.; DAVID LEONARD & LEVINE; SUZANNE-AUGUSTINE; A. GOODMAN & CO.; MARY LEE, INC.; HANNAH TROY, INC, Publicity: Leonard W. Gendler, Exec. Secy., CH. 426945.

properties.title: DANCE RECITAL BY JOSE LIMON
properties.description: Recital by Jose Limon, assisted by Ellen Love, Letitia Ide, Meg Mundan and Miriam Pandor. Tickets: $1.20-$3.60 (tax included). Publicity: Fern Helscher, 115 Hast 57th St, PL 5-3748.

properties.title: RETURN ENGAGEMENT: "BLOOMER GIRL"
properties.description:
A six-weeks' return engagement of the clever musical about suffragettes,
featuring Nanette Fabray, Dick Smart, Peggy Campbell, Hubert Dilworth,
and Matt Briggs. Produced by John C. Wilson in association with Nat
Goldstone. Directed by William Schorr; dances by Agnes De Mille;
costumes by Miles White. Publicity: Willard Keefe, Cl. 6-7492.

properties.title: NINTH WEEK: METROPOLITAN OPERA,
OPENING: “THE BIG Two"
properties.description: New comedy by Le Bush-Fekete and Mary Helen Fay, produced by Zlliott Nugent and Robert Montgomery (by arrangement with David Bromson),featuring Claire Trevor and Philip Dorn, with Felix Bressart, Edward Franz, Wauna Paul. Staged by Robert Montgomery. Settings: Jo Mielziner. Costumes: Bianca Stroock. Publicity: Richard Maney, WI. 7-6939.

properties.title: OPENING: “STREET SCENE"
properties.description: Dwight Deere Wiman and The Playwrights’ Company present a musical version of Elmer Rice's drama with Norman Cordon, Anne Jeffreys, Polyna Stoska, Richard Manning and Sydney Rayner. Music by Kurt Weill; book by Elmer Rice. Director: Charles Friedman. Settings: Jo Mielziner. Costumes:Lucinda Ballard. Publicitys William Fields, CI. 5-7930.

properties.title: OPENING: “FINIAN'S RAINBOW"
properties.description: Lee Sabinson and William R. Katzell present a new musical by He Y. Harburg, Fred Saidy and Burton Lane based on Irish legends. Cast features Ella Logan, Albert Sharpe, Donald Richards, David Wayne, Arita Alvanez, and the Lyn Murray singers. Director: Bretaigne Windust. Scenery and lightings Jo Mielziner. Costumes: Bleanor Goldsmith. Publicity: Sam Friedman,CH. 2-8048.

properties.title: SONJA HENIE HOLLYWOOD ICE REVUE
properties.description: Sonja Henie and her Hollywood Ice Revue -- featuring "The Bon-Bon Shop","The Sleeping Beauty", "Pink Tea", "Circus Days", and "Hula". Sonja will skate nightly in the Garden, January 23-30 inclusive, and February 3-11 inclusive Tickets: $1.25-$6.00. Publicity: Lillian Jenkins, CGO. 5-6800.
